title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When a new 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, and an invalid date string (e.g. '55/66/9999') is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted. The report design then shows the following definition: 
<parameters><scalarParameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarParameter></parameters>
Two problems are observed: 
1. The model does not store the dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss) to ensure portability.
EB: The invalid date/time value should be rejected when entered in the 'default value' field of a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer. The report design should not show the invalid value.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer. 
2. Create a new 'DateTime' type report parameter. 
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string (e.g. '55/66/9999'). 
4. Save the report design and check the definition of the report parameter.
